channel.title: Cache repacker HELP PLEASE!
channel.description:
Well i got this is my cache repacker
[code]@ECHO OFF COLOR 1F CLS ECHO. ECHO Exporting NEW Cache Files. ECHO. set PATH=C:\Program files\Java\jdk1.6.0_02\bin javac *.java ECHO. pause[/code]
[code] Exporting NEW Cache Files.
javac: file not found: *.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options
Press any key to continue . . .
[/code]
Why wont it work

item.title: Cache repacker HELP PLEASE!
item.dc:creator: @Syrillia Syrillia
item.description:
@Syrillia wrote:

@ECHO OFF
COLOR 1F
CLS
ECHO.
ECHO Exporting NEW Cache Files.
ECHO.
set *1*=C:\Program files\Java\jdk1.6.0_02\bin
set *2*=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_02\bin
javac *.java
ECHO.
pause

OK put that in your compile.bat. Go to start>run>cmd. Type in ‘set’ and hit enter. That will list all environmental variables on your pc. Whether they’re user or PC. Find you classpath variable. Now replace 1 with that variable. Make sure it’s exactly the same, enviromental variables tend to be case-sensitive. Or at least they are on my PC. Now do the same for classpath. Hope that helps.

Read full topic

item.title: Cache repacker HELP PLEASE!
item.dc:creator: @Eh_Pretty_Easy Eh Pretty Easy
item.description:
@Eh_Pretty_Easy wrote:

Hahaha, fuck, that’s just a compiler. See javac *.java, not a cache repacker + file not found: *.java is because you don’t have any .java files.

Read full topic

item.title: Cache repacker HELP PLEASE!
item.dc:creator: @Syrillia Syrillia
item.description:
@Syrillia wrote:

I’m guessing that your actually using update 2. That’s what that path is set for. Try setting the CLASSPATH also.

Read full topic
